entry.title: Christys - RH-PURP-PT-12 - Red Hot Purple Primer (Pint)
entry.summary:
Vendor: Christys
Type: Glue & Primers
Price: 12.98

Purple Primer

  • Professional grade, aggressive primer for use on PVC and CPVC pipe and fittings
  • Aggressive formulation softens pipe & fittings prior to application of solvent cement
  • Purple color enables visual confirmation that primer has been applied.
  • For use with any Christys Solvent Cement, excluding ABS.
  • Not for use on ABS pipe and fittings
Color: Purple
Body: Water Thin
Maximum Pipe Diameter: N/A
Relative Set Time: N/A
Industry Performance Specifications: ASTM F-656
NSF/ANSI 14, NSF/ANSI 61
SDS: View PDF
Product Specification Sheet: View PDF
Compare To: IPS P-70, Oatey Purple Primer


DIRECTIONS: The function of Christys® Purple Primer is to penetrate and soften the mating surfaces of plastic pipe and fittings to be solvent cemented. This may be considered an optional aid for small diameter piping up through 2� and recommended for sizes 2 1/2� and larger and for Schedule 80 and CPVC or where local codes specify a primer. Use within 3 years of date stamped on bottom of can. Do not use primer on ABS pipe or fittings.

1. To check penetration “ while still wet, scrape, scratch or abrade away a few thousandths of the primed surfaces to be bonded.
2. Use proper size applicator (dauber, brush, roller, swab) at least 1/2 the diameter of the pipe. Work into pipe in a scrubbing motion. Do not simply paint-on or wipe on/off with a rag. 3. Avoid puddling primer in joints and excess primer in bell end of pipe. Apply primer to female end first until totally wet and soft.
4. Apply to male end of pipe area equal to female end socket depth.
5. Reapply to female end.
6. Immediately and while surfaces are wet, apply appropriate Christy PVC/CPVC Cement following the instructions on cement can.
7. DO NOT TEST FINISHED JOINT WITH AIR. STORE BETWEEN 40ºF (4ºC) AND 110ºF (43ºC).

PRECAUTIONS: Do not handle until all safety precautions have been read and understood
¢ Keep away from heat, hot surfaces, sparks, open flames and other ignition sources. No smoking ¢ Obtain special instructions before use ¢ Do not eat, drink, or smoke when using this product ¢ Wear protective gloves/eye protection/face protection ¢ Wash hands thoroughly after handling ¢ Avoid breathing fumes/gas/vapours ¢ Use only outdoors or in a well-ventilated area ¢ Store in a well-ventilated place. Keep container tightly closed ¢ Store Locked up ¢ IF IN EYES: Rinse cautiously with water for several minutes. Remove contact lenses, if present and easy to do. Continue rinsing ¢ IF EXPOSED or concerned: Get medical advice/ attention ¢ IF INHALED: Remove person to fresh air and keep comfortable for breathing ¢ IF SWALLOWED: Call a POISON CENTER/doctor if you feel unwell ¢ Do not induce vomiting. Rinse Mouth ¢ Dispose of contents/container in accordance with local regulations

s:variant.title: RH-PURP-PT-12 | Pint Red Hot Purple Primer

entry.title: Arrow - 911-PP - Purple Primer (Pint)
entry.summary:
Vendor: Arrow
Type: Glue & Primers
Price: 8.95

911 is a Low-VOC, very aggressive and fast acting Primer for use on all classes and schedules of PVC and CPVC pipe and fittings.  The Primer will deeply penetrate and soften the joining surfaces of the pipe and fittings.

  • Meets Low-VOC emission limit as outlined by South Coast Air Quality Management District (SCAQMD) 1168/316A and BAAQMD Method 40.
  • Compliant with LEED® (Leadership in Energy and Environmental Design).  When using this Low-VOC product , can be claimed for LEED Green Building Rating System “ Indoor Environmental Quality.
  • Listed by NSF International for compliance with ASTM F 656, the Uniform Plumbing Code (Purple only), NSF/ANSI Standard 14,  NSF/ANSI Standard 61 for use on potable water, drain, waste, vent and sewer applications (pw-G-dwv-sw) and NSF/ANSI Standard 372 ˜lead free.
  • Premium formulation for use in all PVC and CPVC piping systems, specifically recommended for Schedule 80 and large diameter applications.  Ideal for use in cold weather applications.  Use of the purple color provides for easy identification that primer has been used on joining surfaces.

Documents

Product Data Sheet

Safety Data Sheet

entry.title: Arrow - 901-P - PVC Cleaner, Clear (Pint)

Vendor: Arrow
Type: Glue & Primers
Price: 11.00

901 is a Low-VOC, fast acting solvent cleaner  that cleans all classes and schedules of PVC, CPVC and ABS pipe and fittings.

  • Meets Low-VOC emission limit as outlined by South Coast Air Quality Management District (SCAQMD) 1168/316A and BAAQMD Method 40.
  • Compliant with LEED® (Leadership in Energy and Environmental Design).  When using this Low-VOC product , can be claimed for LEED Green Building Rating System “ Indoor Environmental Quality.
  • Formulated to clean and remove the surface dirt, grease and oil from the pipe and fitting joining surfaces.

entry.title: Arrow - 1104MB-P - Medium Bodied PVC Cement (Pint)
entry.summary:
Vendor: Arrow
Type: Glue & Primers
Price: 9.53

1104MB is a medium bodied, fast setting PVC cement for use on all schedules and classes of PVC pipe and fittings up to 6'' diameter with interference fit;  Schedule 80 through 4'' diameter.

  • Meets Low-VOC emission limit as outlined by South Coast Air Quality Management District (SCAQMD) 1168/316A and BAAQMD Method 40.
  • Compliant with LEED® (Leadership in Energy and Environmental Design).  When using this Low-VOC product , can be claimed for LEED Green Building Rating System “ Indoor Environmental Quality.
  • Listed by NSF International for compliance with ASTM D 2564, the Uniform Plumbing Code, NSF/ANSI Standard 14,  NSF/ANSI Standard 61 for use on potable water, drain, waste, vent and sewer applications (pw-G-dwv-sw) and NSF/ANSI Standard 372 ˜lead free.
  • High-strength formulation for plumbing, irrigation, pool & spa, conduit, sewer, drain, waste and vent piping systems.

1132 Pool & Turf is a medium bodied, EXTREMELY fast setting PVC cement for use on all schedules and classes of PVC pipe and fittings up to 6'' diameter with interference fit; Schedule 80 through 4'' diameter.

  • Meets Low-VOC emission limit as outlined by South Coast Air Quality Management District (SCAQMD) 1168/316A and BAAQMD Method 40.
  • Compliant with LEED® (Leadership in Energy and Environmental Design). When using this Low-VOC product , can be claimed for LEED Green Building Rating System “ Indoor Environmental Quality.
  • Listed by NSF International for compliance with ASTM D 2564, the Uniform Plumbing Code, NSF/ANSI Standard 14, NSF/ANSI Standard 61 for use on potable water, drain, waste, vent and sewer applications (pw-G-dwv-sw) and NSF/ANSI Standard 372 ˜lead free.
  • Premium PVC cement specifically formulated to cure extremely fast in wet conditions and/or where quick pressurization of piping system is required. Suitable for use on rigid and flex PVC piping systems.

entry.title: Christys - RH-RHBG-HP-36 - Red Hot Blue Glue (1/2 Pint)
entry.summary:
Vendor: Christys
Type: Glue & Primers
Price: 9.98

Red Hot Blue Glue

  • Contractor Preferred... "The Original Blue Glue that quickly bonds PVC pipe & fittings for fast pressurization and maximum productivity
  • The industrys highest quality "Blue Glue - Premium formulation designed to bond in wet, dry and humid conditions
  • Industrys fastest acting solvent cement with the most active ingredients
  • Can be used without a primer for non-pressure systems up to 6" and pressure systems below 4", if local codes permit
  • For PVC pipe and fitting applications; potable water, pressure, non-pressure, conduit, drain, duct, DWV and sewer
Color: Blue
Maximum Diameter: 6" PVC Schedule 40 all classes and schedules.
4" Schedule 80.
Body: Medium
Relative Set Time: Very Fast Set
Industry Performance Specifications: ASTM D-2564
  NSF/ANSI 14
  NSF/ANSI 61
SDS: View PDF
Product Specification Sheet: View PDF
Compare To:

No Direct Comparison - Industry's highest quality Blue Glue from the leading producer of high performance solvent cements.

 

DIRECTIONS: For use on PVC plastics. Stir and use as is. DO NOT THIN CEMENT. Discard if jellied. Use within 3 years of the date stamp on the can.

1) Cut pipe square, deburr, and wipe clean. Make a trial dry-fit - pipe should fit snugly 1/3 - 2/3 snugly into the fitting. Use an adequate sized applicator at last 1/2 size of pipe diameter Dauber, brush, roller or swab. Apply Christys Primer if required by local code. Uniform Plumbing Code requires the use of a purple primer. CAN BE USED WITHOUT A PRIMER IF LOCAL CODES PERMIT for non-pressure systems up to 6" and pressure systems below 4".

2) Apply a full, even coat of cement to the outside of the pipe and a medium coat of cement o inside of the fitting. Coat pipe a second time. Quickly assemble jointly while cement is still fluid on both parts. If dry, pipe and fitting must be re-coated. Push and rotate pipe into the fitting until pipe bottoms in the socket. Hold together until joint sets (approx. 30 seconds).

3) Remove excess cement. Leave joint undisturbed for at least 10 minutes. Full joint strength should be reached within 24 hours depending upon temperature and humidity. See installation Guide for product set and cure time and additional information. STORE BETWEEN 40 °F (4 °C) and 110 °F (43 °C) DO NOT TEST WITH AIR.

 

This product is not for use in a system using or being tested with compressed air or gases.
